main event: A silver streak was observed dropping off or disappearing after a flying object in Birmingham, Alabama, on April 10, 1958, at 0925 CST.
interesting points: The sighting lasted for approximately 1 minute, and it involved a single unidentified flying object.
The object was described as moving at an extremely high rate of speed, and no insignia was observed on it.
The report includes photographs, indicating visual documentation of the event.
The sighting was reported by Major Edward H. Avie and Captain Donald J. Lang from the 2nd Two Target Squadron, George AFB, California, adding credibility to the observation.
The observation raised the possibility of the flying object being an aircraft dropping or jettisoning bombs or fuel tanks.
sighted object: a silver streak dropping off or disappearing after a high-speed flying object
witnesses: Major Edward H. Avie, Captain Donald J. Lang
